org.mindswap.owls.process.execution
Class DefaultProcessMonitor

java.lang.Object
  org.mindswap.owls.process.execution.BaseProcessExecutionMonitor
      org.mindswap.owls.process.execution.DefaultProcessMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, ProcessExecutionMonitor
Direct Known Subclasses:
SimpleThreadedMonitor
public class DefaultProcessMonitor
extends BaseProcessExecutionMonitor

A simple process monitor implementation that prints the progress to standard out (default constructor), or to a given writer.

DefaultProcessMonitor

public DefaultProcessMonitor()
Will write progress to standard out.

DefaultProcessMonitor

public DefaultProcessMonitor(java.io.Writer out)
Parameters:
out - The writer to be used for writing progress to.
Method Detail

executionStarted

public void executionStarted()
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called only once when the execution of the top-most process starts.

executionFinished

public void executionFinished()
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called only once when the execution of the top-most process finishes. Note that if execution fails for any reason this function will not be called. Instead ProcessExecutionMonitor.executionFailed(ExecutionException) will be called.

executionStarted

public void executionStarted(Process process,
                             ValueMap<Input,OWLValue> inputs)
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called before the execution of a process starts. The user has the option to modify the contents of the inputs. ProcessExecutionMonitor.setMonitorFilter(int) can be used to control if this function will be called for all the processes or only for a specific type of process (e.g. only atomic processes).

executionFinished

public void executionFinished(Process process,
                              ValueMap<Input,OWLValue> inputs,
                              ValueMap<Output,OWLValue> outputs)
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called after the execution of a process finishes. The user has the option to modify the contents of outputs. ProcessExecutionMonitor.setMonitorFilter(int) can be used to control if this function will be called for all the processes or only for a specific type of process (e.g. only atomic processes).

executionFailed

public void executionFailed(ExecutionException e)
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called when the execution fails due to an exception. This function is intended to be hook where the user can do something to fix the problem, i.e. ask for additional inputs. There is no such support at the moment. The execution engine will re-throw the exception right after this function returns.

Parameters:
e - The exception.

executionContinued

public void executionContinued(Process process)
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called after the interrupted execution of a process has been continued. ProcessExecutionMonitor.setMonitorFilter(int) can be used to control if this function will be called for all the processes or only for a specific type of process (e.g. only atomic processes).

Parameters:
process - The process whose execution has been continued.

executionInterrupted

public void executionInterrupted(Process process,
                                 AtomicProcess lastProcess)
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called after the execution of a process interrupts. ProcessExecutionMonitor.setMonitorFilter(int) can be used to control if this method will be called for all the processes or only for a specific type of processes (e.g. only atomic processes).

Parameters:
process - The process whose execution was interrupted.

intermediateResultsReceived

public void intermediateResultsReceived(ValueMap<Parameter,OWLValue> values)
Description copied from interface: ProcessExecutionMonitor
Called after the perform of a process to return the outputs of the process. Therefore, value changes for intermediate results can be monitored. ProcessExecutionMonitor.setMonitorFilter(int) can be used to control if this function will be called for all the processes or only for a specific type of process (e.g. only atomic processes).

Parameters:
values - The outputs returned by the performed process.
